Comments_List: Learned Matlab programming, several machine learning, and data mining techniques
this course shows me all basic yet important methods in data mining.
Well it's hard to say, maybe a understanding of some data mining techniques?

The strength of this course was that because it was so hard, I learned a ton. However, I think the course could be refocused somewhat. Guy tried to cover too much material, sacrificing depth for breadth. I think rather than try to cover as many techniques as possible, and having us learn to write our own implementations for all of them, the course should address some of the practical challenges of data mining, including how to collect and clean data, when certain techniques should be used compared to others, and how to interpret results. 

In particular I think SVM, Isomap, and Diffusion maps could be eliminated or moved into an advanced Data Mining course. I would have liked to learn lasso or other regression based methods, and also learn how to scrape websites for data. 

In a sentence: less focus on writing our own machine learning algorithms, more focus on how to use, implement, and interpret different packages on actual messy data sets.
This course helps me develop a clear understanding about data mining, which is a hot topic these days.

The workload of this course is pretty high. Actually I spent over 30 hours on average for each homework, and each only accounted for 10% of the final grade. What's more, we still have a  group project.
The homework was not well designed. The workload was huge.
Yes with some caveats. See my other responses
I will definitely recommend this course to them as long as they have enough time and solid math foundation.

No. Guy is a nice person, but his teaching technique is not as good as his jokes. The are a lot of mathematic equations in his slides but there is no comments or explanation for the meaning of symbols in those equations.
